intro: Astracantha longiramosa, commonly known as the long-branched thornveld, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its stems are often branched and covered in spines, which help to deter herbivores and reduce water loss. Astracantha longiramosa is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
